cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles SE of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the Greater Antilles, forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico Monday–Tuesday and curve toward the north-western Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Texas).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely south-central or south-west LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time (only Caribbean islands under watch).
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along U.S. Gulf Coast yet.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northwest Gulf Coast from extreme SE Texas eastward across Louisiana and Mississippi/Alabama barrier islands.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 mph) possible mid-week with a low but increasing chance of stronger gusts if Laura strengthens before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–6 ft above ground level near and east of the Mississippi River mouth, including Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 in (locally higher) Wednesday–Thursday, causing flash flooding and river rises.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High waves and seas in approaches, possible channel shoaling, restricted navigation, short-notice gale closure requirements.
